messages.content:
Here is the raw transcript to clean:

{{60.text}}

You are an expert transcript processor specializing in converting raw audio transcripts into clean, semantically tagged content ready for repurposing across multiple formats.
Current task: Clean Raw Transcript.
Follow these rules without altering speaker intent or tone:

Remove filler words (‚Äúum,‚Äù ‚Äúuh,‚Äù ‚Äúyou know,‚Äù ‚Äúlike,‚Äù ‚Äúso,‚Äù ‚Äúactually‚Äù).

Eliminate false starts, stutters, and duplicate phrases.

Add punctuation for readability and fix obvious grammar.

Do not summarize, rewrite, or change meaning.

Preserve the speaker‚Äôs natural voice.

Flag any incomplete thoughts, vague references, or abrupt endings for later completion.

‚Äã

messages.content:
Insert inline tags in the following cleaned transcript:

{{57.result}}

You are an expert transcript processor.
Current task: Add Semantic Context Tags to the cleaned transcript provided below.
Tag inline, directly after the relevant phrase, using only the tags defined:

Core content tags: [TOPIC: ‚Ä¶] [STRATEGY: ‚Ä¶] [INDUSTRY: ‚Ä¶] [TOOL: ‚Ä¶] [CHANNEL: ‚Ä¶] [ASSET: ‚Ä¶]

Status tags: [INCOMPLETE] [CLARIFY] [ASSUMPTION] [ENHANCE]
Rules:

Tag only what is explicitly stated or clearly implied.

Limit to 1-3 tags per sentence.

Do not rephrase or summarize.

Flag every gap with [ENHANCE].

‚Äã

messages.content:
Apply structure, style tags, and enhancements to the tagged transcript below:

{{56.result}}

You are an expert transcript processor.
Current task: Add Structure and Style Tags, then complete all flagged gaps.
Tag inline with at most 2 tags per paragraph, choosing from:

Structure: [STRUCTURE: Story] [STRUCTURE: Framework] [STRUCTURE: List] [STRUCTURE: Comparison]

Style: [STYLE: Opinion] [STYLE: Tactical] [STYLE: Commentary] [STYLE: Data]

Section: [SECTION: Hook] [SECTION: Main] [SECTION: Conclusion]

Enhancement: [ENHANCED SECTION] [ENHANCED CONCLUSION]
Enhancement requirements:

Resolve every [INCOMPLETE], [CLARIFY], or [ENHANCE] flagged earlier.

Add concrete examples where references are vague.

Provide a clear conclusion if the ending is abrupt.

Maintain the speaker‚Äôs authentic voice; do not alter original text‚Äîonly add.

Mark all new material with [ENHANCED SECTION] or [ENHANCED CONCLUSION].

notes.content:
This workflow is for cleaning/tagging content that's already been transcribed

üßæ Automation Naming Explained

This automation was renamed for clarity:

[IN USE] Airtable ‚Üí Google Docs ‚Üí OpenAI: Transcript Cleanup and Semantic Tagging (v1)

  • [IN USE] signals this is actively running and ready.
  • Airtable ‚Üí Google Docs ‚Üí OpenAI shows you the workflow‚Äôs sequence of tool handoffs.
  • Transcript Cleanup and Semantic Tagging highlights its exact value.

What is the primary input? üì•

  • The automation is triggered by a custom webhook call containing an Airtable Record ID.
  • It fetches the corresponding record from your designated Airtable base and table, then uses the ‚ÄúGDoc Transcript ID‚Äù field to pull the relevant transcript text from a Google Doc.

Who is this for? üë•

  • Solopreneurs, creators, and small teams who need to quickly process, clean, and semantically tag audio/video transcripts for repurposing.
  • Perfect for content marketers, podcast hosts, or educators looking to get more mileage from their spoken-word content.

What problem does this solve? ‚öíÔ∏è

Manually cleaning up raw transcripts and applying useful tags for repurposing is slow, tedious, and distracts you from big-picture work. This workflow:

  • Automatically fetches, cleans, and tags your transcripts‚Äîso you can focus on sharing, publishing, and growing, not formatting and editing.

What this workflow does ‚öôÔ∏è

  • Converts raw, unstructured transcript text into cleaned, punctuated, and semantically tagged content, ready for blogs, socials, or training materials.
  • Tags content by topic, structure, style, and more‚Äîmaking future reuse, search, and remixing simple!
  • This comprehensive workflow transforms a transcript GDoc into a polished, tagged asset through a 5-step process:

Step 1: Webhook Trigger

Starts when you (or another automation) send a Record ID to the custom webhook endpoint.

Step 2: Fetch Airtable Record

Uses the Record ID to pull all metadata‚Äîincluding the Google Doc Transcript ID‚Äîfrom your selected Airtable table (‚ÄúAsset Library‚Äù).

Step 3: Retrieve Google Doc Transcript

Pulls the full transcript text using the GDoc Transcript ID.

  • Connection: Uses your ‚ÄúCLOS (mike@contentleverageos.com)‚Äù Google account.

Step 4: Clean Transcript with OpenAI

Sends the raw transcript to OpenAI GPT-4.1 with this user+system prompt:


text
User prompt:
Here is the raw transcript to clean:

{{text_from_GDoc}}

System prompt:
You are an expert transcript processor specializing in converting raw audio transcripts into clean, semantically tagged content ready for repurposing across multiple formats.
Current task: Clean Raw Transcript.
Follow these rules without altering speaker intent or tone:

Remove filler words (‚Äúum,‚Äù ‚Äúuh,‚Äù ‚Äúyou know,‚Äù ‚Äúlike,‚Äù ‚Äúso,‚Äù ‚Äúactually‚Äù).
Eliminate false starts, stutters, and duplicate phrases.
Add punctuation for readability and fix obvious grammar.
Do not summarize, rewrite, or change meaning.
Preserve the speaker‚Äôs natural voice.
Flag any incomplete thoughts, vague references, or abrupt endings for later completion.

Step 5: Add Semantic Context Tags (OpenAI)

Sends the cleaned transcript to OpenAI with this user+system prompt:


text
User prompt:
Insert inline tags in the following cleaned transcript:

{{cleaned_transcript}}

System prompt:
You are an expert transcript processor.
Current task: Add Semantic Context Tags to the cleaned transcript provided below.
Tag inline, directly after the relevant phrase, using only the tags defined:

Core content tags: [TOPIC: ‚Ä¶] [STRATEGY: ‚Ä¶] [INDUSTRY: ‚Ä¶] [TOOL: ‚Ä¶] [CHANNEL: ‚Ä¶] [ASSET: ‚Ä¶]
Status tags: [INCOMPLETE] [CLARIFY] [ASSUMPTION] [ENHANCE]
Rules:
Tag only what is explicitly stated or clearly implied.
Limit to 1-3 tags per sentence.
Do not rephrase or summarize.
Flag every gap with [ENHANCE].

Step 6: Add Structure, Style Tags, and Enhance Content (OpenAI)

Sends the tagged transcript to OpenAI with this user+system prompt:


text
User prompt:
Apply structure, style tags, and enhancements to the tagged transcript below:

{{tagged_transcript}}

System prompt:
You are an expert transcript processor.
Current task: Add Structure and Style Tags, then complete all flagged gaps.
Tag inline with at most 2 tags per paragraph, choosing from:

Structure: [STRUCTURE: Story] [STRUCTURE: Framework] [STRUCTURE: List] [STRUCTURE: Comparison]
Style: [STYLE: Opinion] [STYLE: Tactical] [STYLE: Commentary] [STYLE: Data]
Section: [SECTION: Hook] [SECTION: Main] [SECTION: Conclusion]
Enhancement: [ENHANCED SECTION] [ENHANCED CONCLUSION]
Enhancement requirements:
Resolve every [INCOMPLETE], [CLARIFY], or [ENHANCE] flagged earlier.
Add concrete examples where references are vague.
Provide a clear conclusion if the ending is abrupt.
Maintain the speaker‚Äôs authentic voice; do not alter original text‚Äîonly add.
Mark all new material with [ENHANCED SECTION] or [ENHANCED CONCLUSION].

Setup üß∞

üö® Before getting started, you'll need:

  • Airtable account with the relevant base/table (‚ÄúAsset Library‚Äù)
  • Connected Google Workspace account (for Docs access)
  • OpenAI account with GPT-4 API access
  • (Optionally) a tool like Make (Integromat) to run this workflow, or another platform to handle the webhook and automations

Configuration:

  • Set up and copy your custom webhook URL (trigger).
  • Make sure your Airtable base/table fields are mapped correctly (especially ‚ÄúGDoc Transcript ID‚Äù).
  • Confirm your Google account has access to the relevant Docs.
  • Verify your OpenAI connection and ensure correct model selection (gpt-4.1).
  • Adjust or extend tagging/cleaning prompts as needed for your repurposing workflow.

Resources üîñ

  • Getting Started with Webhooks in Make (Official Guide)
  • Airtable API Documentation
  • Google Docs API Overview
  • OpenAI GPT-4 API Reference
  • More Context Engineering Resources
  1. https://ppl-ai-file-upload.s3.amazonaws.com/web/direct-files/attachments/66473654/b29b3ad6-4a96-41ad-a5e4-b5f3f70570ce/paste.txt
